message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.StringTokenizer;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String[][] buyer = new String[10][15];
        Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.print("Specify which area you want to buy: ");
        String input = scan.nextLine();
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, "-");
        int row = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
        int column = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
        System.out.print("Name of the buyer: ");
        String name = scan.nextLine();
        buyer[row][column] = name;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we are using the StringTokenizer class to split the input string into tokens using the hyphen as the delimiter. The nextToken() method is then used to retrieve the row and column numbers from the tokens. The row and column numbers are then used to update the buyer array with the name of the buyer.
